Should thou see a company of little children, mere sucklings, wouldest thou desire glory from them? ¹Be thus affected towards all men with respect to glory.

Itis for this reason called vainglory. Dost thou see the

masks worn by stage-players? how beautiful and splendid they are, fashioned to the extreme height of elegance. Canst thou shew me any such real countenance? By no means. What then? didst thou ever fall in love with them? No. Wherefore? Because they are empty, imitating beauty, but not being really beautiful. Thus human glory is empty, and an imitation of glory: it is not true glory.
